AD_BanditsDiscussion.synopsis: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.synopsis: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.

EntranceDoor.synopsis:
This is the same character as Andorn, the bandit guard within the chapel.

This character is talking to the players through a door - he's locked the door and is on the other side, so they'll be talking TO the door and can't see him.

The player is talking to a gullible bandit through a door - the bandit is inside a chapel dungeon and his friends are outside. The player has probably either killed them or scared them away at this point. The guard is not very bright...

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.synopsis: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.

BanditInteraction.synopsis: The bandits are encountered near an abandoned chapel and are in the middle of an argument among themselves about whether or not to investigate (and loot) the crashed nautoloid (a spaceship) when the player approaches them. The player can convince them to clear off via lies or threats, or else is forced to fight them. A gnome named Gimblebock is in charge of this group, with his underlings, Quelanna and/or Taman, chiming in at points with their concerns.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.synopsis: The player comments on how they talked the bandits into leaving (or companions react to the player's successful persuasion).

VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart.synopsis: The player lockpicked the crypt door that shadowheart was trying to bash.

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.synopsis: A bandit sees the corpse of one of his companions, killed by a falling boulder

AD_Bandit_Ranger_01_CrushedReaction.synopsis: A bandit reacts to the corpse of a dead companion, crushed by a falling boulder

AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.synopsis: A bandit sees one of his friends crushed (dead) by a boulder and doesn't have a great deal of sympathy

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead.synopsis: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.

AD_BanditReaction.synopsis: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.synopsis: Right outside of the abandonned chapel of Selune you encounter a few bandits arguing among themselves. They are rightfully surprise to see you get out of the ruins and worried about the fate of their friend inside.

AD_Boulder.synopsis: Players are investigating a loose boulder outside a chapel that can be shifted to smash through into the crypts below

BanditWestInteraction.synopsis: Alternate version of the confrontation scene between Gimblebock and his bandits at the crypt - triggers if the player approaches the scene from the side, alerting Warryn first.
BanditWestInteraction.how_to_trigger: Repro Steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 277.944; 24.782; 354

VB_Fissure_1.synopsis: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_2.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion_2.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_4.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion_4.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_3.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion_3.text: Either we act now, or someone else will pick that wreck clean and leave us nothing.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_1.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion_1.text: Haven't seen anyone but us. It's just wilderness out here.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_6.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion_6.text: There could be all sorts of loot in that thing - don't you want to be rich?

AD_BanditsDiscussion_0.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion_0.text: Of course I want to be rich - but not if it'll get me killed.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_7.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion_7.text: Hells. Pity you aren't as good at graverobbing as you are at excuses.

AD_BanditsDiscussion_5.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion_5.text: Just being careful. Like my mum always said, fools rush in.

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction_0.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction_0.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction_0.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

EntranceDoor_18.text: That you, Gimblebock? Everything all right out there?
EntranceDoor_18.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's reacting to them trying to open it and thinks they're his accomplice, a gnome called Gimblebock (ɡɪmbəl-bock)

EntranceDoor_20.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor_20.text: Gimblebock ran. Your friends abandoned you.

EntranceDoor_11.text: Yeah? That lot always were a bit soft.
EntranceDoor_11.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's just found out his friends have run away; he's not particularly surprised

EntranceDoor_8.text: But I've got plenty of friends who ain't soft. Come in here and you can meet 'em...
EntranceDoor_8.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Just found out players scared his friends away, but he's threatening rather than scared. But he's also bluffing.

EntranceDoor_2.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor_2.text: I killed your friends - now I'm here for you.

EntranceDoor_6.text: Yeah? I've got plenty more friends - come in here and you can meet 'em...
EntranceDoor_6.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Just found out his friends have been 'dealt with' by the player but feels relatively safe behind the door and is threatening. With a hint of bluffing.

EntranceDoor_13.text: You sound a bit shaken, boss. Hang on while I find the key...
EntranceDoor_13.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just claimed to be his 'boss' - a  bandit leader - and he's going to unlock the door to let them in

EntranceDoor_5.text: Think I'm stupid? Don't know who you are, or what you've done with the boss...
EntranceDoor_5.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. PLayer just tried to imitate his boss - a bandit leader - and he saw through the deception. He's not going to let them inside and is a little bit concerned about what's happened to his boss.

EntranceDoor_15.text: ...but if you come through that door, you're getting a knife in the guts.
EntranceDoor_15.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. he's threatening the player, who just tried to convince him they're his boss unsusccessfully. He's bluffing a little bit and is more worried than he's letting on

EntranceDoor_7.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor_7.text: Yes, it's me. Let me in!

EntranceDoor_16.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor_16.text: Gimblebock triggered some trap. He needs help - now!

EntranceDoor_21.text: I told him it wasn't safe out there. Get inside, and I'll rustle up some bandages...
EntranceDoor_21.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just lied to him, telling him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured in a trap. He's annoyed and a little concerned that this has happened and prepares to unlock the door

EntranceDoor_12.text: Yeah? And who are you? Probably your trap that did him in...
EntranceDoor_12.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured by a trap. He's calling us out on the lie

EntranceDoor_19.text: Come through that door, and you're getting a knife in the guts.
EntranceDoor_19.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. he's threatening the player, who just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was harmed by a trap. He's bluffing a little bit and is more worried than he's letting on

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

BanditInteraction_1.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_1.text: ...You're both twice as tall as me but have half the bloody backbone!
BanditInteraction_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene setupNodeContext: bandit leader speaking to his crew - annoyed with them. He's a gnome, braver than the taller characters

BanditInteraction_22.speaker: Taman
BanditInteraction_22.text: But we don't know what that thing even is! And what about the crypt?
BanditInteraction_22.context: NodeContext: Arguing for caution - they've never seen the likes of the ship that crashed before. It could be dangerous.

BanditInteraction_32.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_32.text: I'm telling you - it's a ship.
BanditInteraction_32.context: NodeContext: the 'crypt' is inside the chapel they're standing outside. 'Thing' refers back to that. 'STOP!" is him interrupting himself because he's just seen the players approaching

BanditInteraction_7.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_7.text: And the crypt can wait! Mari and Barton have been trying to break in for days. Now we - Stop!

BanditInteraction_42.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_42.text: Got ourselves competition already! That's our ship!
BanditInteraction_42.context: NodeContext: 'competition' refers to the players. He's seen them coming

BanditInteraction_19.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_19.text: I don't want to hurt you, but provoke me, and I'll keep stabbing long after you're dead.

BanditInteraction_37.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_37.text: I am not competition. I am annihilation.

BanditInteraction_5.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_5.text: I mean no harm - I'm just looking around.

BanditInteraction_18.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_18.text: First you look, then you touch, then you take!
BanditInteraction_18.context: NodeContext: He's not happy with the player saying they're just looking around, and he's going to attack soon.

BanditInteraction_27.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_27.text: The only thing we're sharing with you is our pointy ends - get 'em!
BanditInteraction_27.context: NodeContext: He's going to attack the player, who just said they were just looking around.

BanditInteraction_11.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_11.text: That ship is full of monsters. I wouldn't go near it.

BanditInteraction_3.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_3.text: I think that ship's an invasion force. Run while you can!

BanditInteraction_2.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_2.text: The only thing you own is your life. Leave before I take that, too.

BanditInteraction_34.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_34.context: NodeContext: We scared the gnome off from attacking us or investigating the crashed ship, though he doesn't really want to show it too much.

BanditInteraction_13.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_13.text: C'mon, you lot, no point in gettin' killed. Second worm gets the cheese, an' all...
BanditInteraction_13.context: NodeContext: He's still a little bit shaken from our intimidation, but tries to get over it, by proposing to wait the danger out.

BanditInteraction_35.speaker: Taman
BanditInteraction_35.text: Uh, second mouse gets the cheese, no?
BanditInteraction_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Underling hesitantly chimes in, correcting the gnome's mixed metaphor.NodeContext: Hesitantly chiming in to correct the boss's mixed metaphor: 'the second worm gets the cheese'.

BanditInteraction_38.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_38.text: Nobody's getting any damn cheese! Now move it!
BanditInteraction_38.context: NodeContext: Annoyed because his underling corrected him on mixing up a methaphor. He isn't shouting too lood, because he just got intimidated and doesn't want to make too big of a scene.

BanditInteraction_29.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_29.text: You're all hot air - think you can get us to leave that bounty to you? Not a chance!
BanditInteraction_29.context: NodeContext: Looking down on the player (figuratively, not literally) - we tried to scare him away, but he won't be intimidated. He's going to attack soon.

BanditInteraction_40.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_40.text: What're you lot waiting for? Get 'em!
BanditInteraction_40.context: NodeContext: Ordering his underlings to kill the player.

BanditInteraction_14.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_14.text: Your loud words hide fear, confusion. Looting that ship will bring you no peace.

BanditInteraction_24.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_24.text: Selfish cur - there might be survivors, yet you think only of loot. Leave before I make you leave.

BanditInteraction_23.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_23.text: That is my kin's prize, not yours.

BanditInteraction_20.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_20.text: Oh yeah? Well, I don't see any of your kin here to claim it!
BanditInteraction_20.context: NodeContext: Replying to a player saying the ship he wants is their kin's prize. He thinks he's got the upper hand.

BanditInteraction_15.speaker: Taman
BanditInteraction_15.text: What's wrong with their face? Freak.
BanditInteraction_15.context: NodeContext: Unnerved and hostile upon seeing someone of a species not common to this world (a githyanki - yellow skin, black eyes, pointed ears and high, flat nose).

BanditInteraction_16.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_16.context: NodeContext: hostile upon seeing someone of a species not common to this world

BanditInteraction_4.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_4.text: Nothing's yours but your life - and I can take that from you just as easily.

BanditInteraction_17.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_17.context: NodeContext: The player just taunted him, and he's trying to retort, but he's very intimidated.

BanditInteraction_31.speaker: Taman
BanditInteraction_31.text: I ain't fighting them. Not a chance.
BanditInteraction_31.context: NodeContext: Decides that the player isn't someone to mess with; tells his/her superior in no uncertain terms that they don't have his back if a fight breaks out.

BanditInteraction_12.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_12.text: Take your best shot - you'll only get one.

BanditInteraction_0.speaker: Player
BanditInteraction_0.text: That ship's full of poisonous vapours. Probably demonic. I'd stay away.

BanditInteraction_10.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_10.context: NodeContext: surprised and a little scared - he was just told that the thing he was going to loot emits poisonous fumes.

BanditInteraction_26.speaker: Taman
BanditInteraction_26.text: See? That thing could be carrying a plague for all we know!
BanditInteraction_26.context: NodeContext: His/her fears are validated - they should clear off rather than court danger.

BanditInteraction_33.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditInteraction_33.text: ...We're, uh... we're leaving! C'mon, move it!
BanditInteraction_33.context: NodeContext: He's intimidated/scared and his subordunate just told him she doesn't want to fight, so he's backing out of the fight.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction_0.speaker: Player
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction_0.text: Lucky those bandits valued their own hides over their loot.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction_1.speaker: Player
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction_1.text: Good work. Thought we had a fight on our hands.
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction_1.context: NodeContext: pleased that the player just managed to avoid a fight, except the Laezel option in which she thinks the player was weak for avoiding the fight

VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart_0.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart_0.text: What, you got it open, just like that...?
VB_LockpickingCrypt_1_WithShadowheart_0.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous/exasperated: she's just witnessed someone easily open a door that she's been trying to break down the last while.

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction_0.speaker: Taman
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction_0.text: We'd have been safer in the crypt!
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction_0.context: NodeContext: reacting with shock on seeing a dead friend

AD_Bandit_Ranger_01_CrushedReaction_0.speaker: Warryn
AD_Bandit_Ranger_01_CrushedReaction_0.context: NodeContext: sees the corpse of a friend, crushed by a boulder. Assumes it's an accident. More complaining than sad.

AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction_0.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction_0.text: How the hells did that happen?!
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction_0.context: NodeContext: seeing a companion crushed by a boulder - he thinks it was an accident but is unnerved

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_26.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_5.speaker: Gimblebock
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_5.text: Thieving. Looting. Cutting throats... wherever there's gold...

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_32.speaker: Gimblebock
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_32.text: The others, searching... chapel ruins. Can't get into lower crypt...

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_6.speaker: Player
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_6.text: Do you have many people inside?

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_18.speaker: Gimblebock
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_18.text: Handful... Andorn guarding the door. The rest searching...

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_0.speaker: Player
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_0.text: Did you find valuables in the ruins?

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_1.text: How do I get into the crypt?

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_13.speaker: Gimblebock
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_13.text: Door sealed... can't break it... can't pick it... must be something...

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_8.speaker: Player
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_8.text: Did you know you were breaking into a chapel dedicated to Jergal?

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_31.speaker: Gimblebock
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_31.text: No. Doesn't matter... if his loot's good...

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_7.speaker: Player
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_7.text: Who was this chapel dedicated to?

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_3.speaker: Narrator
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_3.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_30.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_33.speaker: Narrator
Bandit_Melee_01_Dead_33.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_20.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_20.text: ...You're both twice as tall as me but have half the bloody backbone!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minionsNodeContext: Angry, domineering. Short-tempered gang boss berating his underling's caution.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_21.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_21.text: Whoever was flying that thing can't have survived - whatever's left is up for grabs!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_21.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minionsNodeContext: Angry pep talk.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_14.speaker: Warryn
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_14.text: Look out! Someone's comin' from the crypt!

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_8.speaker: Taman
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_8.text: Look out! Someone's comin' from the crypt!

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_2.speaker: Quelenna
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_2.text: Look out! Someone's comin' from the crypt!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Notices the players exiting from the crypt.NodeContext: An urgent call - alerting comrades to an intruder. *match VO and acting length between actors*

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_26.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_26.text: What the - Who're you?! That crypt's ours; think you can clear it out from under our noses?
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to spot the player.NodeContext: An angry challenge.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_17.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_17.text: Now we're going to - Wait! Who're you? And how did you get in there?!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minions - but turns to you when he realises you're near.NodeContext: Cut off mid sentence by the realisation that the player is nearby. Challenges them. They just appeared through a door that was supposedly secure.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_25.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_25.text: That crypt's ours - we've got people guarding it! Tryin' to off us and swipe the loot, is it?
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_25.context: NodeContext: Anger, with a little confusion. Assumes we're rivals trying to poach his loot.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_24.speaker: Player
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_24.text: Leave, before I gut you like I gutted Mari and Barton.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_1.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_1.context: NodeContext: Alarm and incredulity. He's just learned his back-up isn't coming, and that this intruder uncannily pointed to his unspoken fear (because they read his mind and used his worries against him).

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_12.speaker: Player
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_12.text: You have awoken me from my slumber - now I crave your blood!

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_6.speaker: Player
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_6.text: You have awoken me from my slumber - now I crave your blood!

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_5.speaker: Player
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_5.text: It's mine now. Leave, before things get ugly.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_7.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_7.text: C-c'mon, you lot, let's get out of here!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gimblebock addresses his minions, telling them to flee.NodeContext: Nerves showing a little as he orders his underlings to retreat. He's bottled it.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_22.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_22.context: NodeContext: Bluster and hostility. He was unconvinced by the player's attempts to lie or intimidate him.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_13.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_13.text: Where are the others? Mari, Barton? Did they kill them...?
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_13.context: NodeContext: Tense, a little worried. Could this intruder have the upper hand? Gimblebock's internal thought, being eavesdropped upon by the player.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_9.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_9.text: What...? Get out of my head!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted_9.context: NodeContext: Instant alarm and anger - realising the player is trying to read his mind.

AD_Boulder_0.speaker: Player
AD_Boulder_0.text: Wouldn't take much to send that stone crashing downwards...
AD_Boulder_0.context: NodeContext: Investigating a large piece of masonry suspended from a wooden crane.

BanditWestInteraction_23.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction_23.text: You! Not another step, hear me?
BanditWestInteraction_23.context: NodeContext: Sharp ultimatum mixed with a little surprise. Found the player approaching from the side of the structure.

BanditWestInteraction_32.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view).NodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view)

BanditWestInteraction_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player

BanditWestInteraction_0.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_0.text: What's this then - trying to creep around us and loot the crypt? Not happening.

BanditWestInteraction_8.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_8.text: Or is it the ship you're after? Don't matter either way - it's ours, all of it.

BanditWestInteraction_18.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_18.text: I mean no harm - I'm just looking around.

BanditWestInteraction_2.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_2.text: First you look, then you touch, then you take!
BanditWestInteraction_2.context: NodeContext: He's not happy with the player saying they're just looking around, and he's going to attack soon.

BanditWestInteraction_20.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_20.text: The only thing we're sharing with you is our pointy ends - get 'em!
BanditWestInteraction_20.context: NodeContext: He's going to attack the player, who just said they were just looking around.

BanditWestInteraction_4.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_4.text: That ship is full of monsters. I wouldn't go near it.

BanditWestInteraction_1.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_1.text: I think that ship's an invasion force. Run while you can!

BanditWestInteraction_5.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_5.context: NodeContext: We scared the gnome off from attacking us or investigating the crashed ship, though he doesn't really want to show it too much.

BanditWestInteraction_24.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_24.text: C'mon you lot, no point in gettin' killed. Second worm gets the cheese, an' all...
BanditWestInteraction_24.context: NodeContext: He's still a little bit shaken from our intimidation, but tries to get over it, by proposing to wait the danger out.

BanditWestInteraction_36.speaker: Taman
BanditWestInteraction_36.text: Uh, second mouse gets the cheese, no?
BanditWestInteraction_36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Underling hesitantly chimes in, correcting the gnome's mixed metaphor.NodeContext: Hesitantly chiming in to correct the boss's mixed metaphor: 'the second worm gets the cheese'.

BanditWestInteraction_35.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_35.text: Nobody's getting any damn cheese! Now move it!
BanditWestInteraction_35.context: NodeContext: Annoyed because his underling corrected him on mixing up a metaphor. He isn't shouting too lood, because he just got intimidated and doesn't want to make too big of a scene.

BanditWestInteraction_10.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_10.text: You're all hot air - think you can get us to leave that bounty to you? Not a chance!
BanditWestInteraction_10.context: NodeContext: Looking down on the player (figuratively, not literally) - we tried to scare him away, but he won't be intimidated. He's going to attack soon.

BanditWestInteraction_31.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_31.text: What're you lot waiting for? Get 'em!
BanditWestInteraction_31.context: NodeContext: Ordering his underlings to kill the player.

BanditWestInteraction_7.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_7.text: The only thing you own is your life. Leave before I take that, too.

BanditWestInteraction_25.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_25.text: Your loud words hide fear, confusion. Looting that ship will bring you no peace.

BanditWestInteraction_29.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_29.text: Selfish cur - there might be survivors, yet you think only of loot. Leave before I make you leave.

BanditWestInteraction_15.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_15.text: That is my kin's prize, not yours.

BanditWestInteraction_28.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_28.text: Oh yeah? Well, I don't see any of your kin here to claim it!
BanditWestInteraction_28.context: NodeContext: Replying to a player saying the ship he wants is their kin's prize. He thinks he's got the upper hand.

BanditWestInteraction_33.speaker: Taman
BanditWestInteraction_33.text: What's wrong with their face? Freak.
BanditWestInteraction_33.context: NodeContext: Unnerved and hostile upon seeing someone of a species not common to this world (a githyanki - yellow skin, black eyes, pointed ears and high, flat nose).

BanditWestInteraction_30.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_30.context: NodeContext: hostile upon seeing someone of a species not common to this world

BanditWestInteraction_21.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_21.text: Nothing's yours but your life - and I can take that from you just as easily.

BanditWestInteraction_12.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_12.text: Take your best shot - you'll only get one.

BanditWestInteraction_14.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_14.context: NodeContext: The player just taunted him, and he's trying to retort, but he's very intimidated.

BanditWestInteraction_16.speaker: Taman
BanditWestInteraction_16.text: I ain't fighting them. Not a chance.
BanditWestInteraction_16.context: NodeContext: Decides that the player isn't someone to mess with; tells his/her superior in no uncertain terms that they don't have his back if a fight breaks out.

BanditWestInteraction_9.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_9.text: ... we're, uh... we're leaving! C'mon, move it!
BanditWestInteraction_9.context: NodeContext: He's intimidated/scared and his subordunate just told him she doesn't want to fight, so he's backing out of the fight.

BanditWestInteraction_3.speaker: Player
BanditWestInteraction_3.text: That ship's full of poisonous vapours. Probably demonic. I'd stay away.

BanditWestInteraction_26.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction_26.context: NodeContext: surprised and a little scared - he was just told that the thing he was going to loot emits poisonous fumes.

BanditWestInteraction_17.speaker: Taman
BanditWestInteraction_17.text: Don't like the sound of this, boss...
BanditWestInteraction_17.context: NodeContext: His/her fears are validated - they should clear off rather than court danger.
